definition: to receive/to accept/to enjoy/to bring into/to pay (tax etc)/nano- (one billionth)/to reinforce sole of shoes or stockings by close sewing

sentences.english: This is just a little something, please accept it.
sentences.chinese: 这是一点小意思，请笑纳。

sentences.english: I am a china lawyer and I only can provide legal papers here.
sentences.chinese: 我是一名中国律师，我只会写点法律文章，请笑纳。

sentences.english: A: This is just a little something, please accept it.
sentences.chinese: 这是一点小意思，请笑纳。

sentences.english: This is a little something for you, Mr. Brown.
sentences.chinese: 布朗先生，这是给您的一点小礼物，请笑纳。

sentences.english: Here is a little, something from my company, please take it.
sentences.chinese: 这是我们公司的一点小意思，请笑纳。

sentences.english: Gave NJ a chance and they took it.
sentences.chinese: 给了网队一个机会，而他们也不客气的“笑纳”了。

definition: lit. presenting the Buddha with borrowed flowers (idiom); fig. to win favor or influence using sb else's property/plagiarism
toss a peach, get back a plum (idiom); to return a favor/to exchange gifts/Scratch my back, and I'll scratch yours.
gift given to sb when meeting them for the first time
to return a greeting/to send a gift in return
(of a gift) to be a small token of one's feelings
I appreciate your kindness (conventional reply to turn down an offer)
